labels.analysis: The Keycloak MCP Server is designed to manage Keycloak users and realms through standardized automation tools. It primarily handles user creation, deletion, listing, role assignments, and group management. This server simplifies Keycloak administration by integrating with existing MCP workflows to streamline identity and access management (IAM) tasks.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Security & Authentication" is chosen because the server directly interacts with Keycloak's identity and access management features. Secondary labels "API Integration" and "Database Operations" were selected because the tools interact with Keycloak's APIs for data querying and management. The predefined labels sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Keycloak MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @HaithamOumerzoug/keycloak-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage Keycloak users and realms through a standardized protocol. Create, delete, and list users and realms, assign client roles, and manage group memberships efficiently. Simplify Keycloak administration by integrating with your existing MCP workflows.

tools.name: create-user
tools.description: Deploy Server Keycloak MCP Server @HaithamOumerzoug/keycloak-mcp Try in Playground create-user

tools.description: List users in a specific realm

tools.name: add-user-to-group

tools.name: list-client-roles
tools.description: List roles in a specific client

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@HaithamOumerzoug/keycloak-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
